article.headline: Brown 79, Hartford 61
article.story: WEST HARTFORD, Conn. (AP) -- Chris Skrelja shot 11-of-12 from the field and 7-of-8 from the free throw line and got a career-high 29 points as Brown University defeated the University of Hartford 79-61 on Saturday. Damon Huffman added 20 points and hit six three-pointers, while Mark McAndrew also finished in double figures with 16 points for Brown (6-4). Hartford (5-8) was led by junior Jaret Von Rosenberg, who finished with 17 points and added a pair of assists. Sophomore Joe Zeglinski and junior Warren McLendon each added 13 points. Brown scored quickly with the game's first 10 points. Hartford answered with 16 straight points to take a 16-10 lead with 11:49 to play in the half. The Bears then countered with a 12-0 run to take back the lead for good.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
